first_para: Mike Hookem (born 9 October 1953) is a Member of the European Parliament for the Yorkshire and the Humber region for the UK Independence Party. He was elected in 2014.

full.extract:
Mike Hookem (born 9 October 1953) is a Member of the European Parliament for the Yorkshire and the Humber region for the UK Independence Party. He was elected in 2014.
Hookem joined UKIP in 2008. He stood as UKIP candidate in the constituency of Hull East in the 2010 general election. He finished fourth with 2,745 votes (8%).
Hookem was UKIP's regional chairman for Yorkshire and North Lincolnshire until his election. He was replaced as chairman by Judith Morris from July 2014.
full.title: Mike Hookem
